results.title: All the pretty horses
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Miramax Films, Robert Salerno and Billy Bob Thornton
results.brief_description: John Grady Cole (Matt Damon) and his friend Lacey Rawlins (Henry Thomas) are young Texan men dreaming of an exciting life as cowboys. They set out for Mexico in search of employment, adventure and a better life. On their travels they met Jimmy Blevins (Lucas Black), a drifter wanted for stealing a horse, and they allow him to join their travels. In Mexico, they begin working for Hector de la Rocha (Ruben Blades), a wealthy landowner, raising his young and idealistic daughter, Alejandra (Penelope Cruz) alone. When Alejandra professes her love for Cole, her aunt (Miriam Colon) fights desperately to break up their love affair. When the authorities discover the boys working on the property, their past catches up with them and they are arrested for the theft of the horse. Cole must fight to prove his innocence and win back Alejandra. A coming of age western directed by Billy Bob Thornton, based on the novel of the same time by Cormac McCarthy.

results.title: All the presidents men
results.creator_credit: Walter Coblenz, Wildwood Enterprises, Warner Bros Pictures and Alan Pakula
results.brief_description: This is an understated thriller which remains close to Woodward and Bernstein’s account of the uncovering of the Watergate trail of corruption right to the President’s door. Together with Klute (1971) and The Parallax View (1974) it forms what has been called Pakula’s ‘paranoia trilogy’: film noir for the seventies. This film updates the investigative drama in pseudo-documentary style which had been a significant phase of film noir in the forties. The labyrinth in 1973 is the communication network which has to be commanded and manipulated for the investigator-reporters to uncover the enigmas facing them, the voice of Deep Throat in the darkness of subterranean carparks notwithstanding. Cast includes Dustin Hoffman, Robert Redford, Jack Warden, Martin Balsam and Jason Robards. Based on the book by Carl Bernstein and Bob Woodward.

results.title: All the mornings of the world = Tous les matins du monde
results.creator_credit: Jean-Louis Livi, Film Par Film, Divali Films, DD Productions, SEDIF, FR3 Films, Paravision International and Alain Corneau
results.brief_description: An award winning production recounting the life story of master 17th Century musician M de Saint Colombe (Jean-Paul Marielle) and his brilliant protege, Marin Marais. Marais (Gerard Depardieu), reflects on his life as a student when he fell in love with his mentor’s eldest daughter Madeleine (Anne Brochet). Guillaume Depardieu portrays the young Marais. The musical score, costumes and settings are outstanding.

results.title: All the love [B&W]
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the Spastic Society of Victoria in the care and treatment of the cerebral palsied. Activities are designed to suit individual cases, always with the aim of fiting them for a normal life. Shows a variety of therapeutic treatments, and the organization of workshops within the Centres and under contract to outside companies.

results.title: All the King's Men
results.brief_description: A riveting thriller about corruption in the political arena. Willie Stark, a dynamic backwoods lawyer, batters his way into the Governor’s mansion with the help of his hard boiled secretary, Sadie Burke and reporter Jack Burden. Once elected, Willie uses his unprincipled charm to become a brutal dictator, but his unquenchable thirst for power threatens to topple the monarch and his kingdom. Stars: Broderick Crawford, John Ireland, Mercedes McCambridge. Based on the novel by Robert Penn Warren.

results.title: All the king's men
results.creator_credit: Gareth Neame, BBC-TV, WGBH (Boston) and Julian Jarrold
results.brief_description: An all-star cast portrays this most mysterious and poignant event of the First World War - the disappearance in action of the Sandringham Company at Gallipoli in 1915. Commanded by the Estate Manager, Captain Frank Beck (David Jason), they were just ordinary men - servants, grooms and gardeners - drawn from the staff of the King’s private residence. They left an idyllic rural existence for the fatally ill-prepared campaign and their deaths brought the horrors of the First World War to the heart of the establishment - and to the Royal Family itself. After the war a Special Envoy was sent at the behest of Queen Alexandra (Maggie Smith) to discover what fate had befallen the Company. But the truth was never fully revealed… Also includes a documentary “All the kings men”, produced in 1991 and presented by HRH The Prince Edward.

results.title: All the difference
results.brief_description: Examines the effect pollution can have on a future generation by contrasting the beautiful land of America as described by Walt Whitman, Robert Frost, Robert Penn Warren, Henry Wadsworth Longfellow and other poets, with the pollution of the environment as seen in the smog-obscured skies, dead waters and debris-strewn streets.

results.title: All that mighty heart
results.creator_credit: Edgar H. Anstey, British Transport Federation and R.K. Neilson Baxter
results.brief_description: A portrait of daily life in London. Transport plays a vital part in the scene as rush hour and lull alternate, and as work is replaced by leisure, or the evening gaiety of the West End entertainment. Under the streets another tube line is being tunnelled to carry the increasing number of workers.

results.title: All that jazz starring Kenny Ball and his Jazzmen
results.brief_description: Documentary film featuring Kenny Ball and his Jazzmen performing live on stage interspersed with personal anecdotes by Kenny Ball about his life on the road as a jazz musician. The music is great, from dixieland to gospel, and includes the memorable “Midnight in Moscow” along with “When the Saints go marching in”, “We shall not be moved” and many other jazz favourites. No credits available.
